intro: Lacinaria × gladewitzii, commonly known as the hybrid lace fern, is a rare and ornamental plant that exhibits characteristics of both its parent species. It is a member of the Dryopteridaceae family, which includes various types of ferns. The plant is distinguished by its delicate, lace-like fronds that are divided into numerous narrow segments. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments, preferring well-drained soil. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of rare plants.
